page.title: 10Hillhead Farm.
page.content: Mr Mustard the farmer at Hillhead Farm owns 360 acres of land, 100 acres of barley, 20 acres of turnips and the rest is grass. He has 200 cattle. He usually buys the cattle when they are one year old. He fattens them for one year and then sells them to the slaughter house at the age of two. There are 3 tractors on the farm which cost around Â£14000. Mr Mustard said that to become a farmer you have to have a wide education, know a lot about chemicals and you have to be an early riser. The hours he works are 07.30 to 17.00. He also works as many days as he needs to. Mr Mustard has been a farmer for 10 years and really enjoys the physical work out doors.He has a sheep dog which sometimes bites so it gets locked in the car when visitors come.
